c74object.name: sadam.split
c74object.description:
sadam.split
will route numbers to different outlets according to a set of ranges. These ranges are defined by breakpoints which can either be set as arguments to the object or changed on-the-fly. Numbers that wouldn't match any range will be sent out the leftmost (rightmost) outlet if they are lower (higher) than the lowest (highest) breakpoint.

objarg.name: breakpoint list
objarg.description: Sets the initial list of breakpoints. This will also define the number of outlets, which equals the total number of breakpoints plus one. If any of the numbers in the list is a floating point number, the object will accept and output floats, otherwise it would work with ints. The default list is 0, which means that negative numbers would be routed to the left, while positives to the right outlet.

method.name: float/int
method.description:
On leftmost inlet: Number to be routed.
On any other inlet: Sets the value of the respective breakpoint.

attribute.name: strict
attribute.description: If disabled (0), the breakpoints will allow equality at the top of their respective ranges. If enabled, the breakpoints will not allow equality at the top of their respective ranges (in which case they would allow equality at the bottom of the next range). By default strictness is disabled.
